result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Due to the defendant's incarceration status, and that he will be sent to Indiana to serve sentence once all time is served in Wisconsin, the court is WAIVING the payment of all costs, fees and assessments. Defendant is to provide DNA sample and that cost is waived also.
Concurrent with: any other sentence and concurrent with 15CM1818 and 15CF2679.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Tyrone Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by all parties.  Additional statement by Galene M.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence and concurrent with 15CM1818 and 15CF2679, , with credit for 0 days time served.  Due to the defendant's incarceration status, and that he will be sent to Indiana to serve sentence once all time is served in Wisconsin, the court is WAIVING the payment of all costs, fees and assessments.  Defendant is to provide DNA sample and that cost is waived also.
Defendant remanded.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant at Dodge and not produced; state will complete OTP for next date of 10-29-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 10-2-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 09/21/2015.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is waived for today's date.  
Medical records have been provided to defense today.  The state is requesting that all cases 15CF2679, 15CM1818, and 15CM2331 be joined for trial which is GRANTED by the court.  Defendant has a pending Armed Robbery case (15CF3013) set for plea/sentencing in Branch 21 on 9-15-2015.  The court will set these matters for another final pretrial on 9-10-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
Defendant has pending cases 15CM1818 and 15CF2679 which are set for trial on 9-21-2015.  Upon motion of the state this case is consolidated with those for trial.  Speedy trial demand previously entered.  Defense has no objection to consolidation.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub for Attorney Greg Renden.  Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel, Greg Renden, to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case remains set for Initial Appearance on 8/20/2015 at 8:15 am. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for the defendant filed.  Motion to be heard on 8-10-2015.  Defendant in custody at CJF.

Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Michael Tyrone Wilson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared on behalf of Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. Defense requests an adjourned Initial Appearance. Court granted defense request. Defense waives time limits. Due to Chief Judge directive, case reassigned to Judge Flanagan, branch 4, to follow ADA assigned to case. Court ordered case adjourned to branch 4. Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
